cml:dictionary.title: This is the adapter dictionary for the jobref adapter.
cml:dictionary.dc:author: Martin Kruse

cml:description.xhtml:p: This dictionary defines all available adapter IDs. Maybe this will be remodeled to be replaced with xsd-restrictions on the adapterID-attribute.

cml:entry.title: This is the adapter that gets all adapterinformation for the current job from another.

cml:description.xhtml:p: This identifies the adapter that uses the dict-jobref-adapter.xml dictionary. Further information can be found there.

cml:entry.title: This is the default adapter for MD.

cml:description.xhtml:p: This identifies the default MD adapter which takes every parameter from the initialization block, resolves its dictRef and simply puts DICTREF_VALUE = PARAMETERVALUE into the inputfile.

This identifies one of the default adapters. Input is generated by this adapter the same way as the mdadapter, but without the equality-sign. Input of this adapter is passed to the specified job through the commandline parameter.

cml:entry.title: This is the default adapter for Gaussian 03.

cml:description.xhtml:p: This identifies the default Gaussian 03 adapter.

cml:entry.title: This is the default adapter for Gaussian 09.

cml:description.xhtml:p: This identifies the default Gaussian 09 adapter.

cml:entry.title: This is the adapter for a commandline with fixed parameter positions.

cml:description.xhtml:p: This adapter can be used for building a commandline where parameter are not identified by prefixes (like -r) but are fixed positioned. Parameter for that adapter will be scalars with names of dictionary-entries. The position of one of the parameter will identify the position of the value within the commandline.
